Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: wlbiii
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night. Room excellent: very clean and sizable despite being in Paris. Shower hot and bed comfortable. Close to les Gobelins metro stop and plenty of restaurants and markets. Car park 3 blocks away at 28€ day. Staff very accommodating. Would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Little gem”
Reviews.Author: kevloft
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in this hotel 5 times now and can only say its such a great little hotel.From the reception to the wonderful breakfast lady, rooms pretty good although bathrooms could be upgraded.the location just off rue moufftard make the choice for food excellent after a hard day walking round wonderful Paris. Have stayed in much more exspensive hotels in Paris but keep going back to this one because it is cosy little gem

Reviews.Title: “great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: ann65dublin
Reviews.Content: My sister and i stayed at this hotel for 3 nights this March. The rooms were lovely and not the usual cramped style of Paris. if i were to complain about anything it would be the lack of tea and coffee making facilities in the hotel. We booked room only by accident and the breakfast was 15 euro per person per day we did not avail of this as it was to pricey. Location was fantastic once we got our bearings there was no stopping us. I would definitely go back to this hotel and would recommend it to others. Also when you come out of the hotel and turn left and take your second left there is a fabulous street with bistro's and a fresh fruit market. Here we managed to get a 3 course meal on Sunday fro 14.50 cheapest food we found in Paris and tasted great. Note that this street is closed on Mondays

Reviews.Title: “It's ok...”
Reviews.Author: drumrach
Reviews.Content: The rooms are basic - including no tea/coffee making facilities in the room. 2 English speaking channels on tv. It's an ok location. It's good during the day where there is lots to do in the area but at night if you don't want a typical (terrible) tourist meal, it's hard to find somewhere decent that's not overly expensive. Not many authentic French restaurants around. Metro is close, it's easy to get around. We didn't choose to stay here and I think you could get better value for money elsewhere, especially in winter which is when we travelled.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Low Price and Great quality rooms”
Reviews.Author: WhiskeyHotel
Reviews.Content: I arrived on the Eurostar and transferred to the Metro, getting off at Censier Daubenton and found it was only five minutes walk to the hotel. The staff were very nice, spoke english and checked in no issues. The room was perfect for once person, mirrored robe, plasma tv, desk, queen bed, window, heating, large bathroom with bath and hairdryer. They provide toiletries and update them daily. No fridge in the room which was one downside as there were some nights I wanted to sit in with some cheese and wine. The location is great for those who want to experience the real Paris without as many tourists of Gypsies. Just walk across the road to the Rue Mouffetard and you can buy the best food and wine up this cliche Parisien street. There is a Bistro in front of the fountain about 2 min walk from the hotel (Cave le Bourgone), it is one of the best. Nice staff, amazing food and not too expensive. Mostly locals in the cafe too. There are a few Laundromats nearby also, Only cost me 6 euro to do about 8 days worth of clothes. There is a Velib station out front too, which I highly reccomend. You can use the bike hire service if you swipe your credit card. It's 150 Euro deposit, 8 euro for 7 nights. You get the bike for free if you use it under 30 minutes and it's 1 euro for every half hour after that. I use to just pack up Croissants and ride down to Notre Dame and walk from there each day. I make it down there in about 10 minutes. Check out their website for more information. I had no issues and would definately come back to the hotel, I booked through their website, no dramas. The Free Wifi was great, strong connection allowed me to download movies on itunes (iphone) if I felt like night in.

Reviews.Title: “Good size room”
Reviews.Author: Kimdrum
Reviews.Content: stayed at this hotel in November 2011. There were 2 of us in a superior double. There was plenty of space in this room to put our things, and a safe in the closet for passport, etc, while we were out sightseeing. had a room overlooking the street, never got loud. the front desk staff was nice. the breakfast in the morning was pretty simple french breakfast of deli meats, cheeses, egg, toasts. I don't know if it would be worth the 15 euros a day it costs, but we got included in our room cost, so we ate it.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique, convenient and affordable”
Reviews.Author: JulieMelb0urne
Reviews.Content: The Cardinal hotel is conveniently located to 2 metro stops and in an interesting neighbourhood with fresh food market one block away and boulangerie and other shops nearby. The reception staff are extremely helpful and courteous, all spoke English, and my single room while not large was more than adequate and newly refurbished with a gorgeous bathroom. The included breakfast was basic for a day touring and the Anvil restaurant a few doors away, although not cheap, offers authentic French cuisine without needing to travel into the city. The tariff was affordable especially for a solo traveller. If you want somewhere quiet away from the crowds but accessible to all attractions via the metro this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, awesome location”
Reviews.Author: maggy55
Reviews.Content: My 17-year old daughter and I stayed in this hotel in July 2011. the first room they showed us was small, even by Paris standards, and they offered us a better room (312) if we waited. It was worth it. the new room had been renovated and was not much larger, but more comfortable. The hotel offers breakfast every morning for 15 Euros, but ours was included in the price of our package booked through europeandestinations.com. The breakfast was awesome - eggs (hard boiled), fresh baguettes, Nutella, meats, cheese, good coffee in large cups. We were usually the last ones to arrive and there was always plenty of food. Super comfy beds and pillows and I'm very fussy about such things. As a bonus, just at the end of the street is the foot of the rue Mouffetard, a terrific street for shopping, dining, sitting at a cafe, and meandering. There is a post office just off rue Mouffetard where I bought a cellphone SIM card for 5 Euros. TIPS: - On the map it looks as if Metro Port Royal would be a good option to reach the hote but it was kind of far. The closer - and more charming walk - was to Censier Dauberton on the #7 line. - Buses: This was the first time in my several trips to Paris that I rode the bus a bit. The #27 bus on the rue Claude Bernard (just at the corner) takes you straight to Luxembourg Gardens, or pass there and head straight to the Pont Neuf. - Wander over to the Jardins des Plantes (15 minute walk-ish) and check out the zoo. Who knew? - The bathroom code for the McDonald's restaurant outside one of the gates at the Jardins is 135. I wasn't able to figure out how the toilettes in le jardin worked. - start the day late. nothing really opens early in Paris so you might as well sleep in. Wandering around Paris requires stamina. - Skip the Louvre. If you must, go on Wed. or Fri. evening when the crowds are smaller. It's truly exhausting to go so pick your artwork in advance. I suggest avoiding the Mona Lisa. You'll see more if you look at the photo online. It is fun to hang out in the courtyard at the Louvre. - Check out the Carnavelet Museum near the Places des Vosges. It's the history of Paris and has wonderful art, 16th century store signs, recreations of the room of Proust's bedroom. Way worth it.

Reviews.Title: “First Time Trip To paris”
Reviews.Author: QuietWhisky
Reviews.Content: My partner and I spent 3 nights at the hotel. We arrived via Eurostar and found the hotel easy to find. We used the Censier Daubenton metro stop which was only a 5-10 minute walk. The Reception Staff were all very friendly and spoke english although we did attempt our school time french with them. The rooms were clean and comfortable and included complimentary products. There was also a hair dryer which is a useful thing not to need to pack. The hotel is in a quiet street in a great location. Lots of nice shops and bars/cafes. We felt it was a great base to explore the city and would reccomend it and use in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent base for exploring Paris”
Reviews.Author: partick
Reviews.Content: This is a comfortable clean hotel with pleasant helpful staff in an excellent location for exploring the 5th. Arrondisement on foot and the rest of Paris using the nearby Metro and bus links. My wife and I spent two weeks there recently and would not hesitate to recommend it to other holidaymakers.

Reviews.Title: “Great little 3 star!”
Reviews.Author: CyrusSongad
Reviews.Content: We liked this hotel a lot. Very clean, decent size room for a Paris 3 star. Breakfast was good and the staff were really sweet and helpful. The location is just a short walk from the main areas of the Latin Quarter & Saint Germain districts. If looking for a 3 star in Paris again we would stay here 100%.

Reviews.Title: “Very good!”
Reviews.Author: AngelikaSweden
Reviews.Content: A very nice and clean hotel with a premium room that was worth a four star. Good breakfast with bread, eggs, youghurt, cereals, different kinds of cheese and a lot more. Access to Englishspeaking CNN and BBC World and several french TV-channels. Nice and calm neighbourhood close to two metro stations and very close to bus 27, which takes you over the Seine and straight through Paris. Within walking distance to Rue Mouffetard, a traditional street with shops and restaurants. 10 min walk from train station Port Royal, which has a direct train to Charles de Gaulle Airport (and Orly too, I think). Please notice that you access the street of the hotel from Boulevard de Port Royal through some stairs that are placed on the pavement. Over all a nice and neat hotel with a very nice breakfast (that was included in our package, otherwise it costs 15 Euro)

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, great area”
Reviews.Author: sjkAustralia
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the first one we stayed at on our European adventure, we weren't expecting luxury just a clean and tidy place to stay. We were surprised at the level of comfort and quality of the facilities, having had heard so many bad stories about affordable accommodation in Paris. The service was very good, the ladies working in the breakfast room were friendly and helpful, once we had been there a couple of days and made an effort to greet people in (poorly spoken) French all the staff seemed to warm to us and were extremely helpful and friendly. Our room was small, but overlooked the street and was clean, well furnished and very comfortable. Every day the rooms were made up and fresh towels etc provided. The location was great for accessing good food (Rue Mouffetard) and picnic supplies, the pantheon was only a 15 minute walk as was the Luxembourg Gardens, but other attractions were further away and in hindsight we would have used public transport more because the constant walking was tiring especially when there is so much to see. Across the road is a good pub for having a quiet drink and enjoying a tasty hamburger with frites, the staff there are friendly as well. Access to buses and trains easy, between 3 and 15 minutes walking depending on your chosen destination. We would stay here again, but use the metro and buses to get around, walking to and from attractions made for very long days. We got confused about the breakfast and whether it was included or not, although it is a good and substantial breakfast, at 15 euros per person it is a little expensive and the coffee is not so good. We recommend going to a cafe for your caffeine fix, it is so much better and cheap if you drink it standing at the bar.

Reviews.Title: “once again lovely hotel stay in paris”
Reviews.Author: kevloft
Reviews.Content: stayed in the hotel for the 3rd time and as usual had a great stay. rooms clean and the breakfast and the ladies serving breakfast are excellent.only downside missed the fridge in room which is no longer there. all in all good hotel great area mouftard is great for food etc

Reviews.Title: “pleasant surprise, good location”
Reviews.Author: ellapa79
Reviews.Content: We only spent one night here in transit and used Choice points for the stay. We have spent a lot of time in Paris and previously stayed at another Choice property which was just ok so we were not expecting much. We wanted a non-smoking room but there was not one available when we booked. The girl at the desk was very nice and told us she could change the room if we didn't like it but the non-smoking room would be much smaller so we checked the room first. I am very sensitive to smoke and there was absolutely no smoke smell. The room was quite large for Paris. There was also a small fridge and a safe in the room. The bathroom was small but adequate and the bed was very comfortable. The location is great for walking to restaurants on Mouffetard but not in the middle of all the activity and noise. It's only a short walk to Jardin des Plantes and the river which was perfect for us since we just had an afternoon. For extended stays in Paris we prefer an apt but would definitely stay here again for a brief visit.

Reviews.Title: “A nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: taido
Reviews.Content: The room was really small,but well cleaned every day. There was also a fridge and safety box,which was a bonus.Not much room to put your clothes,so most of ours we just left on a chair. Breakfast was ok,different kinds of bread,cheeses,one kind of ham, fresh fruit salad,eggs,croissants etc.Enough to get you started anyway.We liked the situation,very quiet street,Rue Moufftard very close and took only about 20-25 min. to walk to Notre Dame.Did not need much help from the reception,but there was a nice man working Thursday eve and Friday morning(24.-25.3)a dark man with spectacles. In Paris you can find cheap places where to eat and on the other hand very expensive also.Rue Moufftard and the side streets there were plenty of places.Most of them not too expensive,set menu starting from 16.50€/person.incl. starter,main and dessert.

Reviews.Title: “A pretty hotel”
Reviews.Author: larry_downy
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel when we were on holidays in Paris. We stayed here for one night only. Everything was fine. The location is not the best, but pretty much ok - the metro was not far. It is possible to get to the center on foot, e.g. we went to Notre Dame and it took us about 30 minutes, I think. Breakfast was not included into our stay and we didn't have it (the cost of the breakfast is too high I think - 15 EUR for person) The staff was nice. Room was very clean. We found a very good offer for the price, so it was a good choice I think.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat this hotel for the price and location”
Reviews.Author: jerseygirl1111
Reviews.Content: Had a very pleasant stay at this hotel. The hotel staff was very helpful and friendly. We arrived about 5 hours before check in and they had a room available without us having to store our bags for the day. The location is great because it is near restaurants, metro stop, stores, etc, but is on a quiet side street just close enough to everything, but also out of the way. Our room did not face the street, and the bar/pub across the street from the hotel was closed, so we did not have noise issues at all when in the room. Breakfast was included with our trip package. The food was fine. There was plenty to choose from and they didn't run out of food when the breakfast room was crowded. The hotel room itself was a typical European hotel room. Smaller than hotel rooms in the States, but more than adequate for our stay. From a design standpoint, the bathroom wasn't very user friendly. The sink was so large that it left about 2 feet of the tub open for stepping into/out of the shower. A larger person (or even an average women's US sz 12) would have difficulty maneuvering in that bathroom- either getting out of the shower, or trying to move between the sink and the door. We had an enjoyable stay at the hotel and would return without hesitation!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for seeing all the sights.”
Reviews.Author: Suzetteh Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location for a weekend away, being close to the Rue Mouffetard - quite a lively part of Paris. All the sights can be reached easily on foot or on the metro. We got a really good deal with Octopus travel, especially as breakfasts were included in the price. The room was pleasantly decorated and very clean and we couldn't fault it (once we realised that the hot water had to be run for a few minutes before it got really hot. This did not cause a problem though). We were more than happy with the continental breakfasts - plentiful supply of tasty food and drinks. All staff were very friendly and helpful throughout our stay so, along with all the other factors, I would definitely recommend the hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, would definitely stay there again”
Reviews.Author: JMD26
Reviews.Content: Great location - very near metro stations, and lots of restuarants, cafes, supermarkets, boulangeries, patisseries and yet was in a quiet street. Rooms looked recently refurbished - modern and very clean. Free room safe, wifi and the ability to leave our cases on the day of departure were all a bonus. Breakfast seems to be very expensive so we didn't have it at the hotel but there are plenty of cafes or places to buy your own food nearby.

Reviews.Title: “So disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: CAGirl411
Reviews.Content: I love Paris and the 5th, but was so disappointed with my stay at the Hotel Cardinal! I had a non-smoking room, but somebody had obviously just smoked in the room before I arrived. It was so disgusting and I could hardly sleep because I was choking on the fumes! I had to keep the window open to try and air out the room, but the area outside the hotel was noisy. There is a pub right across the street where there is a lot of noise late at night. The room was tiny and it was very expensive for what I was getting. There was a train strike while I was there, which made getting to the airport difficult by train. The front desk was not very helpful when I asked them about what my options were to get to the airport. I definitely won't stay here next time I am in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with very hospitable staff”
Reviews.Author: stravagante1981
Reviews.Content: Nice small hotel near metro station in peacefull neighbourhood. The staff is very complaisant and willing to help. Breakfast is standard and selfservice: butter, jam, baguette, boiled eggs, croisant... Room is a bit small, but enough. Only objection is a really bad sound isolation, but as I said, it's a very quiet neighborouhood and a guests were not loud so no problems with sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend”
Reviews.Author: IrishLaur
Reviews.Content: Great hotel - good location - a very short work from Les Gobelins (Pink Line) which in turn is handy for the main sights (8 stops in total perhaps) and very handy for the Latin Quarter at night. There also seemed to be a few restaurants and cafes in the area which seemed to be nice although we didnt go to any of them. Hotel room very nice and clean with air con (slightly noisy but not too bad), good shower, and free wifi included. Breakfast basic but nice and included crossaints and breads, cereal, fruit salad, hams & cheeses and yoghurts. Bar across the road slightly noisy at night but wraps up early and not to the extent that it would keep you awake. Would definitely recommend this hotel to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: katrin3112
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel because of the ratings it got online and we where not disappointed. The location of the hotel is really nice - many bars and food shops around. It's a younger part of Paris (many studens) that this hotel is located in which makes it louder at night but gives it a great atmosphere. The rooms are small, like in any other Paris hotel but they are clean. The room doesn't offer much more than a place to sleep but then who needs more when in Paris. Breakfast is quite good for Paris standards - they offer more than dry croissants and coffee which is nice in the morning. And if you are still hungry, just a short walk away there is the farmers market with anything fresh you can wish for. If you are not afraid to right a bike in Paris - just across the street there is a rental station for the city bikes - cheap and easy way to get to all the major places in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Nice comfortable hotel in a good location for Paris sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: ElaineF57
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights at Easter and had an enjoyable visit. The hotel is conveniently located for sightseeing having several Metro stations and an RER station within 5 to 20mins walk. There are also quite a few attractions within walking distance of the hotel. Our room was not huge but ok by Paris standards. The breakfast was plentiful and fresh. The only complaint would be that there are no tea/coffee facilities in the rooms. The hotel is situated near to an interesting street market which is in an area where there are a lot of cafes/bars/restaurants which are frequented by the locals and are by Paris standards reasonably priced but offer nice well presented food.

Reviews.Title: “Nice budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: lamysafari
Reviews.Content: 5-10 mins walk from metro. Nice location at a reasonable price. Furniture in the room is old but acceptable. Staff are very nice and helpful. Walls are a little thin and it could be disturbing if you have a noisy neighbor.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible welcome, good night's sleep.”
Reviews.Author: SheFlop
Reviews.Content: We arrived an hour later than indicated, and were greeted with a severe telling off from the receptionist who had apparently been debating whether to give away our room (the last in the hotel) to another customer should they request it. Officially the worst welcome I have received. Aside from this, the hotel had its good points. It provided an excellent night's sleep, located on a very quiet street, and not a peep from any neighbouring rooms, all of which were occupied. Rooms are avergae sized for budget hotels in Paris. The shower took a while to heat up but had good pressure. There was no kettle. The location could be better, as it is right on the SW edge of the 5th. It is about a 15min walk to the river, but there is a Metro stop a few minutes away for further journeys and a few nice cafes etc nearby. Marty's restaurant around the corner on Rue des Gobelins provided our best meal in the city. Thankfully we did not see the lady that 'welcomed' us later in the stay, all other staff were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “clean, quiet, near to transportation, minimum price”
Reviews.Author: noha_hamed
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderfully clean hotel, with friendly staff and very good service. The cafes and restaurants around it, especially those at Rue Moufftard are excellent. Its surrounding area is not so touristic as other Paris areas, so you basically get quality food at reasonable prices and in a not so crowded atmosphere. The hotel is close to metro stations and not far from most sites. The only draw back is that the rooms are really really tiny. The price is excellent compared to other hotels in paris. It also had free internet. I would recommend it as a convenient and comfortable base for anyone who wants to explore Paris within a tight budget.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need on a city break - quiet and cosy stay”
Reviews.Author: FiaMcK
Reviews.Content: This was a very basic hotel but it was very comfortable and clean and reasonably price compared to other hotels in Paris. It's in a nice area not to far out of the Left Bank and very near the market st Rue Mouffetard. I loved the area as it was not touristy and full of great little bistros. It is very good for buses and metro and the breakfast was lovely. The woman in the breakfast room was charming and the staff in general very helpful and friendly. I would recommend this hotel for a weekend break!

Reviews.Title: “sweet little hotel in good area”
Reviews.Author: lizzylive
Reviews.Content: just back from this hotel and we had a very good experience.... very nice area.. we even got to see the xmas lights on the market street at nite which was great.. very sweet area.. not too noisy.. but our room was opposite the bar and ppl do seem to hang around afterwards and chat away or scoot off on mopeds so i would advise ppl to try and book room on far side of hotel for peace sake.. with metro stop only up the road a bit it was very handy indeed... just one little tip.. we took train to port royal and walked down.. there is market there and some lovely views of streets.. i took some pics and i got stopped by some military police in plain clothes who told me it is forbidden to take pics on that street due to the army hospital being located there.. even though i could not see any signs.. they asked for my id and reason for pics.. but in the end they were polite and asked me not to do so again.. but overall.. i would recommend this area to anyone... so safe to walk to hotel from city centre at nite...

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ruthie17
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated a few minutes away from the rue Mouffetard market- a great neighbourhood. The rooms are small but newly decorated and very clean. The stuff is friendly and helpful. A real gem in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect choice for us.”
Reviews.Author: Videoquest
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from a 13 night stay at this location. This being our 3 rd trip to Paris this hotel was the best for us. The room is on the small side; which seems typical for Paris. We found that the staff, the location, the cleanliness and the overall feel of this hotel was great. Our trip was for pleasure and therefore we were not in our room very much. The staff was very helpful and polite, the room was clean. The hotel is within a 5 minute walk to two Metro stations, albeit on the same line (7). There were also, at least, 2 bus lines that were available at the corner. In our case breakfast was included and was a good start to the day. If you are looking for a full American breakfast, the products offered will not satisfy you. The neighborhood is very safe and we did not, at any time, feel threatened when walking to the hotel after dark. Many restaurants in the area, and as mentioned in other reviews access to the Rue Mouffetard is about 3 minutes away with its market type vendors for fruit, cheese and of course wine. Should we return to the "City of Lights" we will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “small rooms, great location”
Reviews.Author: kengyen
Reviews.Content: We checked in two separate times into this hotel. All rooms seem small. Even by European standards. But there are different layouts that maximize use of the space. The first time we checked in we got room 309. For some reason, this room seemed grungy. I think it was the older linens. Had the feeling that the comforter hadn't been washed in awhile. There was little space between the desk chair and the end of the bed. It was not possible to sit down in the desk chair and walk between the chair and the end of the bed. The bed seemed smaller. Definitely an older double. The second time we checked in we got room 307. This bed seemed larger - I think because it was two twins pushed together. This was nicer. More space to move around. Other friends stayed at the same hotel. Don't think room 205/206 used it's space well. But 312 seemed to work well. Also some rooms had mini fridges some did not. I think most , if not all, of the hotel is non-smoking. No noise complaints. Seemed very quiet. While the area seemed a little further on the edge of St. Germain/the Latin Quarter - it was very close to a quaint street that contained a lot of restaurants and boutiques. Highly recommend the Boulangeries nearby. Easy 5 minute walk to the metro. AC worked very well. Tubs had an unusually high side to step over to get in. People at the front desk were very nice and helpful. - Would stay here again - if I don't get room 309. It was a very good deal through Venere at $145/nt.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing fancy, but still one of the best hotels I've ever stayed in ...”
Reviews.Author: jeppesenhanoi
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 days in Paris last week, and was pleasantly surprised at the comfort and quietness of the Cardinal Hotel. Everything seemed to be just right. Nothing fancy, but just good solid value for the money. The thing I appreciated most was that it was absolutely quiet, and the bed was good and comfortable. It seems that there's always something nagging and annoying me when I stay at hotels, even 4-5 star ones, but in this hotel there was absolutely no nagging at all. Even the internet was working flawlessly, and the staff was very friendly ... Didn't eat breakfast at the hotel, as I prefer the local bakery 150m down the street, which is outstanding, and way cheaper. Location proved to be very good, as both bus and metro quickly can take you to the center, but also, there's a public bicycle stand right by the hotel. Also, there's great food and atmosphere in the very nearby Rue Moffetard ... A few really nice squares along the way, to sit and have coffee and look at the street. I would recommend this no-nonsense top quality hotel to anyone visiting Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel under Reno”
Reviews.Author: parisvacationer
Reviews.Content: I loved the area that this hotel was in!! I was disappointed when I arrived to find that the hotel was under a reno. I was on the 2nd floor and not able to open the windows in the room during my stay. The hotel did not have a computer for guests even though it had advertised that it did. ( wireless is available only if you have your own computer with you) There were big dumpsters outside the front of the hotel for the reno. Really disappointed. Hopefully, once they finish the reno things will be better. The desk staff were very helpful however. They would not compensate for the inconvenience of the reno other than a credit for a shuttle to CDG at the end of my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, rooms not too small, would go back”
Reviews.Author: Need2travelmore2
Reviews.Content: Room – was clean, not too small – you could walk around the bed! Bathroom was modern and clean, my wife was happy about that. Breakfast was typical continental, simple, fresh and well stocked. Room was quiet even though it over looked the street (good double glazing). Staff was very helpful. Night manager on our arrival at 10 PM (thanks to rail strike) suggested a local café – we arrived to join into a French sing along/open mike night. It really helped set our mood for the next 4 days. The breakfast “madam” was helpful and restocked even when we arrived to breakfast at 09:50. Location was good. Easy walk to metro. Also close to local markets (we followed the old French ladies to find them). We booked through 1800 Hotels and breakfast was included.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly adequate for the main local attractions”
Reviews.Author: soulchyme
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights, not our first time in Paris, but we do like this particular area and wanted to stay closer to the Latin Quarter. This hotel provided a good balance between proximity to main areas whilst being in a quiet location. Metro link was good and the Rue Mouffetard was a 3 minute walk. this in itself was a real pleasure and a must if visiting this area. The hotel also had a clean neat feel, with helpful staff. Breakfast on the steep side (14 Euro per person) but plenty of outlets nearby. The only downside was there were improvement works taking place, affecting the back of the hotel and windows could not be opened- a big minus in warm weather. However, following request to be accommodated at the front, there was no problem and the rest of the stay was very good overall.

Reviews.Title: “nice location, well-decorated, very nice staff”
Reviews.Author: hask74
Reviews.Content: we stayed for one night in March. Of course the rue Mouffetard area is a great pleasure. Our twin was not available but the staff person was so nice about it, she upgraded us to a "prestige" room immediately and offered us free breakfasts and copious sincere excuses. Thus the beds are mostly full size, not queen. the regular double rooms are normal small PAris size, the prestige quite a bit larger, with separated toilet. Well decorated, well furnished? Breakfast was high quality croissants etc, served in the room. i did not see the buffet downstairs. If you go on Venere.com you can get good deals, the rack rate seems a bit high for me/

Reviews.Title: “Great experience...”
Reviews.Author: franzworld
Reviews.Content: We booked a 3 night special for my 40th Birthday and were not disappointed. We struggled with deciding on whch area and obviously which hotel. Our budget was tight but we wanted the best we could for our plummeting pound ! The Hotel is just off the Rue Mouffetard but is on a relatively quiet back street so a front of hotel room was taken. They are having work done on the roof at the rear at the moment so our 2nd floor front was perfect. The room size was great for Paris, two singles squeezed together rather than a double but that was no problem. The shower was fast and strong and joy of joys a bath, deep and relaxing was just the ticket after being on your feet all day in January ! Staff were exceptional and spoke English pretty well. Breakfast was fresh and plentiful but get an inclusive breakfast deal as 14E for a buffet is kinda steep. No tea making in rooms unfortunately. Area is good and eating out easy. Port Royal RER is 1km away and easily walkable, right through a market on the way, and this station connects direct to Gard du Nord and CDG...brilliant. Gobelins metro is 500m away and we bought a 10 ticket bundle for 16E at CDG on the way in, it proved just enough for 3 days. A great little hotel in a old part of the city within walking distance of Montparnasse, Notre Dame and the Sorbonne/Pantheon.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely small hotel with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: jetsetterUsa
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for two nights at the end of October. We were able to get a last minute deal for excellent value through a website about 3 days before our trip (and verified choice based on Trip Advisor's reviews). The rooms are small, but very clean and it is a 3 minute walk to the Rue Mouffetard with its open markets on the weekends (as well as the bus stop which takes you right up to Notre Dame in about 20 mins). Of greatest note, however, was the staff who provided exceptionally good and friendly service - above and beyond what I would typically expect. I would return to this hotel again and recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good small hotel in nice area”
Reviews.Author: Bugsy47
Reviews.Content: Excellent friendly small hotel in a quiet street but near a lively area with good cafes, lots of small shops and a lively market. 2 metro stations and regular bus service close by. Bus number 27 goes close to Luxembourg Gardens, Pantheon and Notre Dame. Montparnasse is a comfortable walk turning right up and over the bridge a few yards away. Jardin des Plantes in the opposite direction down Rue Daubenton is a pleasant stroll. Breakfast was fresh and served in the reception area, possibly a bit expensive at 12 euros, but alternatives at the top of the street. Small but perfectly adequate and clean room with ensuite bath / shower combined. Our only quibble was lack of hanging space for used bath towels. Security box and small fridge in the room. TV has CNN in English. There is some building work, the back is clad in scaffolding, but in the 4 days we were there no work was being done. Cases can be safely stored in a locked room on the day of departure. We treated ourselves to the Greek Restaurant Mavrommatis at 42 Rue Daubenton. Although much more expensive (about 50 euros each) than the other local cafes we used (15 to 20 euros) the food was beautifully cooked and presented, a real treat with a couple of pleasant surprises not on the menu.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ajarSP
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Cardinal Rive Gauche for 7 nights in July 2008. Room is very clean, spacious, functional and fairly quiet. Great location, Rue Mouffetard is just a couple of minutes walk from the hotel with many nice restaurants/cafe/boulangeries. Place de La Contrescarpe has great bars (10 mins walk). Easy access to the metro (Censier-Daubenton station - 5 mins walk) and bus (line 27 - 1 min walk.) Very friendly and helpful staff specially the receptionist Ramon. We highly recommend this hotel. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Faultless hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: suespecs
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from an excellent 5 day stay at this hotel. The service across the board was 1st class, the receptionist spoke excellent English and was very helpful and friendly. The bedroom was a good size, very clean and comfortable. The location is great for exploring Paris, the metro (Censier- Daubenton) is just a few minutes away. The Seine is 10 mins walking through the pretty Jardin de Plantes. We found the Rue Mouffertarde a great little road with a fabulous choice of eating places just a couple of minutes away, catering for every budget. We strongly recomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Use your imagination”
Reviews.Author: Harryhaller_8
Reviews.Content: We were here in May 2008, there are construction works taking place on the outside of the hotel, from 8.00am until late in the evening, the noise was complimented by workmen walking past our window on scaffolding. We were in a double room and to say the size of the room was tiny was an understatement, they were absolutely minature. If possible AVOID.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all”
Reviews.Author: check20
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very ok. Clean and good value for money. Staff is helping and professional. The rooms are very small as very often in Paris. Well located (5 min from Les Gobelins metro) and in a nice area of Paris (Rue Mouffetard that brings in 15-20min walk to Notre Dame). Its not exactly as beeing in Place de la Madelaine, however...I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: silje
Reviews.Content: We just got back from an excellent weekend in Paris! The hotel is a very good choise. The rooms are clean and not to small. Nice bathroom. The location is very good! Rue Mouffetard with many nice restaurants/cafe/bars is just a couple of minutes walk from the hotel and also the metro station. Metro line 7 is also only a 5 minutes walk.

Reviews.Title: “No parking, must pay for public parking about two blocks away”
Reviews.Author: LuvToTravelTN
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Comfort Cardinal Rive Gauche Paris for three days in July. The rooms and bathrooms are small but very clean. The breakfast was nice with croissants, yogurt, etc. The hotel is in a safe and quiet area. We came back one night about 11 p.m and the front door was locked. We had to wake the hotel clerk to let us in. That was a little inconvenient, but I would still stay at this hotel again and recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect 4 Paris! U get what u Pay For!”
Reviews.Author: AvaG
Reviews.Content: Compared to the last 3 hotels I've stayed in Paris this one gets top marks! Location: Latin Quarter ....100 metres from Mouffartard. then 5-10min walk to Notre Dame Standard Room:... Very clean. excellent maid service Staff: ..Really Helpful Shops, Cafes: ...Cafe/restuarant across road from hotel. Supermarkets/small shops close by Metro : Les Gobliens 5 mins walk Overall a really nice area. You will be glad to return here after a day sightseeing in Paris....ENJOY!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel & good location”
Reviews.Author: Matt_and_Lily
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in May and really enjoyed our trip. The rooms are small but are comfortable enough. And more importantly, they are clean. The location is nice too, just 5 mins walk to the metro, and there are a few nice cafes and bars around. Staff were friendly and helpful. We didn't have breakfast there, but it looked ok!

Reviews.Title: “Great Find in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: roed
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 3 night stay at the Comfort Cardinal Rive Gauche Paris Hotel, and enjoyed an extremely positive experience. Our room was non-smoking, as promised, and was extremely clean and well equipped with all toiletries and amenities. The room was somewhat small, and had their version of a queen sized bed (two singles pushed together), which was quite adequate. New carpeting and new bathroom tiles/paint gave everything a fresh appearance. Breakfast served in the lobby area (included for us) provided all that was needed to start the day (had great hot coffee, bottles of water). Staff was great, friendly, and provided all info about bus/metro travel. In all, we would return in a heartbeat - were pleasantly surprised by the experience!

Reviews.Title: “Finally, a hotel in Paris we'd go back to!”
Reviews.Author: Jock286
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have been to Paris about half a dozen times in the past few years and until now would not recommend or go back to any of the hotels where we have stayed. However 6th time lucky and the Hotel Cardinal Rive Gauche was a real find! Excellent location close to metro (Les Gobelins), good restaurants (particularly Pizza Caesar), cafes & bars and within walking distance (20 mins) of Notre Dame and the Seine. The hotel itself was reasonable value at around £65 a night, had friendly and helpful staff, a good sized room (for Paris), which was modern, clean and even had good air conditioning. Overall, we're now pleased to say that we've found a Parisian Hotel which we'll go back to and wouldn't hesitate to recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Drelicious
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 5 days in Paris and stayed at the Cardinal Rive Gauche. I would recommend this good value hotel. We have absolutely no complaints about this hotel. Although a little on the small side (normal for Paris), the rooms were very clean and well maintained. We didn't see much of the hotel staff, mainly due to the fact that we would leave in the morning, and wouldn't return until very late at night, but the times we did see them, they were very friendly and courteous. They helped us with directions and bus schedules without any hesitation. We had no issue with street noise either. The hotel is situated on a quiet street (not a main thoroughfare). Our room was on the 3rd floor, facing rue Pascal. The occasional garbage truck in the morning, but that was about it. The location is great as well. It is located between metro Les Gobelins and Censier-Daubenton. We found that Censier-Daubenton was a little bit closer, and was a much nicer walk than going to Les Gobelins. For a genuine Paris experience, the Marche Mouffetard is right around the corner. We would pick ups some fruit, a coffee and a croissant for breakfast every morning. A must! The hotel isn't in a very "touristy" part of town (when compared to other sections), which we enjoyed. After doing all the tourist things during the day, it was nice to come back to our part of town and unwind.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: 1doyler
Reviews.Content: I have heard bad things about Parisian Hotels so I was expecting the worst. Turned out this was a very clean and well kept hotel. It's not a very big hotel and does not have a public area or bar. It does not have a restaurant either but there is an area to eat breakfast in the mornings. Despite the lack of these facilities it is perfect for a short break as you will not be spending much time there anyway. Breakfast was a selection of cereal, fruit, yoghurt, fresh bread and good coffee - more than enough to keep you going until lunch. Reception staff may seem rude at first but you will see that they are very helpful if you need any help. Other staff are very discreet and friendly if you do happen to bump into them. The location is perfect. Bus or Metropolitain get you to the central area where the Louvre and Notre Dam are located in about 10 mins. There is a really lively street with shops selling fresh fish, cooked foods, cheese and wine just up from the hotel, it's not touristy and seems like a place where people living in the city centre might buy their fresh fish, fruit and veg. There are also plenty of good restaurants about, their traditional french bistro dishes are hard to beat. You will not be disappointed if you order confit or fois gras in any of the french restaurants around here. There is an alright bar across the street from the hotel, it's useful for a late drink before bed. Overall, the Rive Gauche is perfectly located and adequately equipped to ensure a great short break in Paris. If you were going to be there for a longer trip maybe a slightly more spacious hotel with a bar and restaurant might be a better option.

Reviews.Title: “Best choice for its price”
Reviews.Author: dwango
Reviews.Content: Excellent location - quiet but close to many interesting places. Many restoraunts and shops nearby. Friendly personal. Clearn room and bathroom, and now it have the shower curtain :) Small and cozy hotel for rest after long intereresting day in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “a nice stay”
Reviews.Author: plaz_re.mu.
Reviews.Content: the hotel is located pretty close to the rue mouffetard, the heart of the lovely Latin Quarter (the best site of paris in our opinion), full of brasseries, bistreaux, pubs, and restaurants from all around the world. you can't really get bored, there! anyway, metro stations are all around (5 mins by walk), if you need to reach museums, isles, atc (subway in paris is incredible! you can go really anywhere, and don't forget to buy the daily ticket "mobilis"!). we stayed 3 nights. the room (with bathroom) was tiny as usually in paris, but comfortable, quiet and clean. the staff was kind and friendly (the last day, when we left the room, we forgot an envelope with some valuable postcards and a gift bought at beaubourg museum shop; we came back 6 hours later and the pocket was still there, at the reception desk). really advised!

Reviews.Title: “perfect for our stay”
Reviews.Author: gargan
Reviews.Content: spent 3 nights in this hotel; the room was clean and comfortable, but small; loved the idea of having a bath though; enjoyed the breakfasts of bread, cheese, yogurts, crossants and fruit. the location was ideal, close to rer and metro; the area had lots of wonderful small restaurents and bars, also the market street; the staff were very helpful; one disadvantage-no bar. mary and gerry. ireland.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: urlaub
Reviews.Content: We spent three days in this comfortable hotel (79 euros per night). The room was a bit small, but very clean. Staff were always helpful and friendly. I couldn't believe the excellent location, 5 min from metro, and close to many shops and restaurants, in a quiet and safe neighbourhood. We didn't have breakfast at the hotel, there are at least four bakeries by the hotel, and for those of you who can't live without a Starbucks there's one down the street from the hotel. we'll stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Good value and great location”
Reviews.Author: Marilla
Reviews.Content: I am very fussy and find it difficult to commit to any booking without having second thoughts! I booked a twin room with a friend and we were both pleasantly surprised. No luxuries but it is clean - most important for me. Staff were friendly and always happy to help. Breakfast was included and this was a basic continental with all you can eat. Location was great, 15mins from Notre Dame and a few minutes walk from Rue Mouffetard, a cobbled street of shops and restaurants. Highly recommended, would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “almost good quality: clean but small room”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel to be of good quality. The room was small. We had a twin bed and it almost took the entire room. The room and bathroom look clean. The bathroom had one disadvantage. when you take a shower the whole bathroom would get wet, because there was nothing to prevent the water from going everywhere. It was just a bathtube with no glass or shower garden. Breakfast was a bit complex because they had 6 tables for the all the guest. So we had to wait awhile before we could have breakfast. It was also possible to have breakfast in the room. The guy at the reception said that they planned to have a separate room where they could serve breakfast, because the 6 tables where posted at the reception area. Metrostation Les Goblins was a five minute walk, so that was a good thing.

HotelInfo.Name: Cardinal Rive Gauche Paris
HotelInfo.Address: 20-22 Rue Pascal | 5th Arr., 75005 Paris, France
